data.title: Social Media Week Lagos: Full Schedule
data.meta_description: Check out the schedule for Social Media Week Lagos
data.text:
10:30am WAT

12:00pm WAT

Staying Profitable In The Time Of Aggregators

Staying Profitable In The Time Of Aggregators is a dynamic panel discussion lead by the Guardian.ng on how news platforms can stay financially relevant in the days of the platform business model.

Learn how to maximize returns on your original content

Learn how to categorize aggregators

Learn how to profit!

Monday February 26, 2018 12:00pm - 1:00pm WAT

Innovation Stage

1:00pm WAT

artHERE: Community Mural Led by Dipo Doherty

Drawing inspiration from social media's impact on the lives of Nigerians and the overall impression the digital economy is having locally, Dipo Doherty take attendees through a collaborative process to co-create a large-scale mural.

artHERE is an initiative in collaboration with local artists. Using public space as their canvas, artHERE collaborators bring art to the people through visual, experiential and audio pop ups throughout the #africanxt pavilion.

Monday February 26, 2018 1:00pm - 6:00pm WAT

Annex

1:30pm WAT

Media Power: How To Effect Change With The Content We Produce

This session is for content producers - digital and traditional - and media entrepreneurs who are interested in making an impact and not just money.

Join top notch panelist curated by The Guardian.ng as they discuss the power of media to effect change.

Monday February 26, 2018 1:30pm - 2:30pm WAT

Innovation Stage

1:30pm WAT

Open Access: Jason Njoku

Open Access is a rare opportunity to have open dialogue with leading CEOs, Founders, policymakers and critical thinkers whose work has had an important impact on Africa’s digital ecosystem.

Open Access with Jason Njoku gets up close and personal with the Nigerian entrepreneur, film magnate and African start-up investor. Jason Njoku is the co-founder and CEO of iROKOtv, the pioneering video-on-demand platforms for Nigerian film and entertainment.

Speakers

Jason Njoku

CEO, IROKO

CEO. Founder. Nollywood. Consumer Internet. Investor

Monday February 26, 2018 1:30pm - 2:30pm WAT

Experience Stage

3:00pm WAT

Inspired for Future Generations: How Music & Edutainment Can Unlock Africa’s Potential

We have a passion to drive education through music and edutainment with our brands. Viacom International Media Networks Africa through its brand diversity and pop culture works to equally drive the proponent of education. Across the youth spectrum we are focused on developing an increase in local talent and education while creating a love for music, culture, creativity and authenticity.

Join us for Inspired for Future Generations a panel of enlightening discussions on How Music & Edutainment Can Unlock Africa’s Potential.

Panelist will explore:

How the digital era can empower the youth to learn. VIMN Africa speaker Bada Akintunde Johnson will share examples of how we have achieved this from Nickelodeon and MTV SHUGA.

Shifting the stereotypes of the African continent to how we are creating opportunities. Statistics on continent and education/technology. 50% of total population growth between 2017 – 2050 is expected to come from Africa. This population is very young with 41% under the age of 15. Music and edutainment offer an important platform for social engagement.

Impact of technology: Almost a billion mobile phones in operation in Africa currently. Media plays an active role in edutainment, filling the gap of education.

Monday February 26, 2018 3:00pm - 4:00pm WAT

Innovation Stage

4:30pm WAT

Evolution of Native Advertising - Brand Storytelling

In this session, we examine the emergence of native advertising trends and their effectiveness in communicating a brand's message across to the target audience. Using the #Pulse36 campaign as a case study, we explore the various elements that make for an effective native advertising campaign.

LEARN:

Pointers on quality content from the brand’s perspective.

Tips on content presentation and a well thought-out distribution strategy.

Elements/features of compelling content including content direction, format, length, Demographic and targeting etc.

Monday February 26, 2018 4:30pm - 5:30pm WAT

Innovation Stage

7:00pm WAT

SMW Opening Nite Party

We’re rolling out the red carpet at SMW Lagos! Please join us on Monday, February 26, in the AfricaNXT Annex from 7:00-10:00 PM to celebrate the opening night of SMW Lagos. This will be an excellent opportunity to network with local marketing professionals and chat with our conference speakers and event organizers. Enjoy complimentary hors d’oeuvres and drinks. All SMW Lagos badge holders will be admitted.

Sounds Courtesy of Teck-Zilla / Str8Buttah Productions

Monday February 26, 2018 7:00pm - 9:00pm WAT

Annex

9:00am WAT

10:30am WAT

10:30am WAT

Making Sense of a World In Motion w/ Segun Agbaje, CEO GTBank

Segun Agbaje, CEO GTBank, shares his thoughts and insights on:

How technology is accelerating change

Living in a time of constant change

Staying true to the fundamentals

The variables that won’t change

Tuesday February 27, 2018 10:30am - 11:30am WAT

Experience Stage

Talk

Featured Featured

2:00pm WAT

artHERE: Maka

Intimate acoustic soul set by singer/songwriter Maka.

artHERE is an initiative in collaboration with local artists. Using public space as their canvas, artHERE collaborators bring art to the people through visual, experiential and audio pop ups throughout the #africanxt pavilion.

Tuesday February 27, 2018 2:00pm - 2:30pm WAT

Annex

3:00pm WAT

Disruptive Journalism & New Media

The aim of this panel is to uncover the effects, opportunities, and possibilities of new media in the field of journalism. Journalism as we know it is rapidly changing, as the emergence of social media and new media has expanded the possibilities for journalists to tell stories in unique ways. New media is giving the journalism industry, an opportunity to break boundaries with the use of new media, while telling the world’s most important stories.

As the leading Business daily in West Africa, BusinessDay Media aims to further the conversation on the disruption in journalism brought about by the emergence of new media. The panel of well- seasoned journalists and new media enthusiasts, will focus on the effect of new media on their work using their own careers as case studies, while also discussing the current state of the journalism industry. This will provide an opportunity to dive into possible ideas and recommendations on how the industry can benefit from the ongoing disruption.

Audience members can expect to learn practical industry knowledge from the esteemed panelists who have adapted to the shift of new media in journalism as well as industry insights as it pertains to the emergence of new media.

Learn how to maximize the disruption caused by new media as a story teller

Learn from west Africa's most recognizable journalists and new media enthusiasts

Learn how to your journalistic content

Tuesday February 27, 2018 3:00pm - 4:00pm WAT

Experience Stage

1:00pm WAT

Feminism & The Nigerian Kitchen

Feminism & The Nigerian Kitchen is a round table discussion to explore the extent to which the role of women in the household has changed.

We'll be asking;

Is it still a woman's role to be in the kitchen? Should Nigerian women be expected to know how to cook certain cultural dishes? To what extent has social media influenced the dynamics of the modern Nigerian family and the way that we cook and consume food? This will also be a chance to hear from some of the leading female chefs carving a space for themselves in the food industry in Nigeria, what has the reception been like for them?

Exploring how social media has influenced the dynamics of the modern Nigerian family and the way that we cook and consume food

Discovering what the current food consumption trends are in Nigeria

Looking at the opportunities within the food industry in Nigeria for both men and women

Wednesday February 28, 2018 1:00pm - 2:00pm WAT

Annex

10:30am WAT

Selling on Social Media vs E-commerce - Where's The Real Money?

Will the fast emerging, millenials-driven world of social media trump the billion dollar e-commerce industry? Is there some truth to the theory of a future of social selling? Or will e-commerce maintain its strong foothold on the online ecosystem?

Thursday March 1, 2018 10:30am - 11:30am WAT

Experience Stage

10:30am WAT

Stanbic IBTC - Financial servicing in the social age

The session is designed to explore our role as a full-fledged universal financial services organization in the new media age; how we have journeyed on the path of innovation through digitization and how we make progress real beyond just delivering products and services for our clients and prospects, but also advisory services to take our clients from financial stability to security; wealth management to creation and ultimately make progress real for them, whatever stage in life they are.

Personal Finance tips in the social age.

An open-invitation to collaborate with us and create the future of digital technology.

Our journey to being the leading universal financial services organization in Nigeria through innovative products to bank, invest and serve the customer instantly (Instant Account for Bank and Mutual Funds, USSD banking et al)

Thursday March 1, 2018 10:30am - 11:30am WAT

Floor 3

12:00pm WAT

Innovating On The Edge Of Innovation: Growing Startups In An Avant-garde Sector

Innovating On The Edge Of Innovation: Growing Startups In An Avant-garde Sector is a panel discussion that explore innovating in a sector that is an innovation in itself. We are going back to basics to discuss competing with the intangible.

We'll Cover:

highly competitive environments/market dynamics demand innovation to survive

Agility/adaptiveness/localisation

Finding the gap in the market and the market in the gap

Thursday March 1, 2018 12:00pm - 1:00pm WAT

Experience Stage

1:30pm WAT

Battling Violent Extremism in Nigeria

Battling Violent Extremism in Nigeria features individuals working in and around north east Nigeria and will provide a glimpse into how they have all in their own unique ways, contributed to the battle against violent extremism. The session will be Moderated by Dr. Muhammad Fraser-Rahim, the Executive Director, North America for Quilliam International. He is an expert on violent extremism issues and a scholar on Africa.

Thursday March 1, 2018 1:30pm - 2:30pm WAT

Innovation Stage

2:00pm WAT

3:00pm WAT

3:00pm WAT

Closer To The North East

This relaxed discussion style session will provide attendees an opportunity to hear from and interact with leaders from north eastern Nigeria.

Thursday March 1, 2018 3:00pm - 4:00pm WAT

Floor 2

4:00pm WAT

How Youth Can Deploy Social Media To Counter Violent Extremism

Join Dr. Muhammad Fraser-Rahim is the Executive Director, North America for Quilliam International as he teaches an engaging and interactive class on the topic 'How Youth Can Deploy Social Media to Counter Violent Extremism'.

Learn:

What does Countering Violent Extremism mean

What role does social media play in Countering Violent Extremism

How can youth use social media for CVE

Thursday March 1, 2018 4:00pm - 5:15pm WAT

Floor 3

4:30pm WAT

Innovation in Governance: A new approach to leadership … A new way forward.

Innovation in Governance: A new approach to leadership … A new way forward.

Peter Obi in Conversation w/ Chioma Chuka

For citizens, policy makers and governments to move our communities, cities and countries forward it is critical to innovate across all sectors including government. This session will be a thought provoking discussion on the importance of citizens, civil society and governments to be innovative in their thinking and approach to governing, collaborating and nation building.

Thursday March 1, 2018 4:30pm - 5:30pm WAT

Innovation Stage

12:00pm WAT

Artificial intelligence: Rise of the Bots - Hosted By UBA Group

Artificial Intelligence: Rise of the Bots

Speaker: Austine Abolusoro – Group Head, Online Digital Banking, UBA

Artificial Intelligence has moved from the buzz word into reality. It is set to influence businesses and disrupt industries in very fundamental ways. One of the very channels through which this will be done is the increasing deployments of Bots. This presentation will highlight the impacts of AI on various businesses and the particular trends that Bots are now creating.

Friday March 2, 2018 12:00pm - 1:00pm WAT

Floor 3

1:30pm WAT

The Future is Female ... Building a Career in Tech on Our Own Terms

A conversation with Omolara Ajele Awoyemi, Country Manager, Jumia Pay

Omolara Ajele Awoyemi is the Country Manager of JumiaPay - Jumia’s payment and financial inclusion company. She was formerly the Head of Strategic Partnerships and Payment Solutions at Jumia Group Nigeria (Jumia Mall, Jumia Food, Jumia Travel and Jumia Classifieds).

Her portfolio covers payment partnerships, product development, developing strategic and revenue generating relationships with disruptive FinTech and mobile forward companies for the Jumia Group. Specifically, she built and managed business executive relationships with dynamic partners in the market - including Jumia investors in Nigeria (MTN and AXA Mansard), Banks, FMCGs, Payment solution providers, Loyalty scheme providers, Airlines, and lots more.

Friday March 2, 2018 1:30pm - 2:00pm WAT

Experience Stage

Talk

Featured Featured

4:00pm WAT

A Great Day in Gidi

A Great Day in Gidi’ is a gathering of Lagos most innovative minds in the tech, media & creative space. From Industry Stakeholders to Digital Activists to Award-winning artists, ‘A Great Day In Gidi’ is a snapshot, of the individuals who collectively are re-defining Lagos and Africa in general. It's a celebration ... and some say “the most epic day party EVER!”

Friday March 2, 2018 4:00pm - 6:00pm WAT

SMW Campus Beach Lounge

4:30pm WAT
